Under LAW , natural persons have the right to protection of their personality rights ( personal integrity ) , in particular their life and health , civil and human dignity , privacy , name and personal characteristics . Under LAW , natural persons have the right to request that any unjustified infringement of their personality rights be ended and that the consequences of such infringement be eliminated . They also have the right to appropriate just satisfaction . LAW provides that , in cases where the satisfaction obtained under paragraph CARDINAL is insufficient , in particular because the injured party ’s dignity or social standing has been considerably diminished , the injured party is also entitled to financial compensation for non - pecuniary damage . Under LAW if pecuniary damage was caused by unjustified interference with personality rights the liability of the perpetrator is governed by the provisions of LAW on liability for damage .
